contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But when Paul insisted that he stay under Roman guard so the emperor could decide his case" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But when Paul called to be kept under guard for the emperor's decision

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the soldiers brought Paul to appear before them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Paul was brought to them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am here, where they are putting me on trial" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I stand here to be judged

contextId.information: The phrase "were killed" can be stated in active form. AT: "and I voted in agreement with the other Jewish leaders to condemn believers to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and when they were killed, I cast my vote against them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am sure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am persuaded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active and positive form. AT: "that he is aware of this" or "that you are aware of this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: that none of this is hidden from him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When the king and the governor decided" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When it was decided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Paul said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that were spoken by Paul

contextId.information: You can make explicit why it was not easy to stay in the harbor. AT: "harbor did not sufficiently protect docked ships during winter storms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: harbor was not easy to spend the winter in

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we stopped trying to sail forward, and we let the wind push us whichever way it blew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we gave in to it and were driven along by it

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "had to go in whatever direction the wind blew us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were driven along

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "everyone stopped hoping we would survive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: any more hope that we should be saved was abandoned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "just as the angel told me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: just as it was told me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This encouraged all of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then they were all encouraged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and he healed them too" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]) (UDB)
contextId.quote: and were healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "some of the Jews arrested me in Jerusalem and placed me in the custody of the Roman authorities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I had to ask for Caesar to judge me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was forced to appeal to Caesar

contextId.information: The abstract noun "accusation" can be stated as the verb "accuse." Here "nation" stands for the people. AT: "but it was not because I wanted to accuse the people of my nation before Caesar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: although it is not as if I were bringing any accusation against my nation

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because we know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because it is known by us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "many Jews all over the Roman Empire are saying bad things about it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is spoken against everywhere

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Paul was able to convince some of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Some were convinced about the things which were said
